Name: GLOBAL_SOFAConventions
Comment: This conventions stores Ambisonics DRIRs derived from RIRs recorded along the spherical surface of an Ambisonics microphone.

Name: GLOBAL_AmbisonicsConversionMethod
Comment: Information about the Ambisonics transform prodecure

Name: GLOBAL_AmbisonicsMicrophoneModel
Comment: Information about microphone used for the recordings

Name: GLOBAL_AmbisonicsOrder
Comment: Degree of the Spherical Harmonic Expansion

Name: GLOBAL_DataType
Comment: We use FIR datatype which in addition depends on Emitters (E)

Name: GLOBAL_License
Default: No license provided, ask the author for permission

Name: GLOBAL_RoomType
Comment: The room information can be arbitrary

Name: ListenerPosition
Comment: ListenerPosition describes the real position of the microphone in the room (useful if positioned off the center of the loudspeakers arrangement for example). M represents the number of positions of the Ambisonics microphone

Name: SourcePosition
Comment: By definition, there is only one source (loudspeaker array) with several loudspeakers (emitters)

Name: EmitterPosition
Comment: Each speaker position is represented as an emitter. Use EmitterPosition to represent the position of a particular speaker, wrt to SourcePosition which may contain the physical coordinates of the loudspeakers arrangement in the room. Size of EmitterPosition determines E.  M dimension not needed since there is always one only source (in this convention, M is not related to emitters but to receivers instead)

Name: Data.IR:ChannelOrdering
Comment: Describes the ordering relationship between Spherical Harmonics. Must be one of: 'acn', 'sid' or 'fuma'

Name: Data.IR:Normalization
Comment: Describes the amplitude relationship between Spherical Harmonics. Must be one of: 'sn3d' , 'n3d', 'fuma' or 'maxn'

Name: Data.SamplingRate
Comment: Sampling rate of the samples in Data.IR and Data.Delay

Name: Data.Delay
Comment: Additional delay of each Ambisonics IR (in samples)
